moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4 exd4 3. Qxd4: The first exchanges, unleashing my queen...
moves.4... Nf6 5. Bg5: I bring up the bishop in case the knight takes my queen...
moves.6. Bxf6 Qxf6: ...so I remove the first knight in exchange for my bishop.
moves.9. Nf3 h6 10. Bc4 O-O 11. O-O Be5 12. Nx: This time I remove a bishop, in exchange for a knight.
moves.13. Nd2 d5: My queen and bishop are in trouble here...
moves.14. Qf4: ...so I decide to save the queen...
moves.15. Nxc4: ...but I do remove my opponent's knight...
moves.16. e5: Time to push the pawn forward.
moves.17... a6 18. Re3 Kh8 19. h4 Qe6 20. Qe4: Time to move the queen away
moves.22... Qg6 23. Rg3: I attack the queen and line up a potential checkmate here...
moves.23... Qf5: ...and the queen moves out of the way...
moves.24. e6: ...and the pawn is a good diversion...
moves.24... f6: ...but my opponent is wise to my move...
moves.25... Rfe8 26. Qd8: ...and bring my queen forward to wreak havoc...
moves.30... Rxc7: Was this the easy way out?
moves.31. Rxe6: Anyway, I got rid of the queen.
moves.31... a5 32. h5: Now I prevent the king from moving forwards
moves.32... b4 33. cxb4: I stop this pawn to prevent a promotion attempt...
moves.35... g6: This move was to give the king room to manoeuvre...
moves.36... Kxg6: ...at the expense of another of mine...
moves.37. Rxb4: ...but I do remove another to empty the board even further.
moves.41. a5 Bc8 42. Ra4 f5 43. a6 Bxa6 44. Rx: Now with the bishop gone, I have a better chance to trap the king...
moves.44... Kg5 45. Rg8+: Now I've blocked off more escape routes.
moves.47... Kf6: This allowed me to box the king in even further...
Now with the rook gone, the game is mine.
